data.title: Adam Ottavino will be first New York Yankees player to wear No. 0
authors: NorthJersey.com Digital Desk, North Jersey Media Group
data.meta_description: This season, Yankees reliever Adam Ottavino will become the first player to don the No. 0 for the Yankees.
data.text:
Every single-digit number has been retired by the New York Yankees. Well, except for zero.

This season, Yankees reliever Adam Ottavino will become the first player to don the No. 0 for the Yankees. The team officially introduced him on Thursday.

Ottavino made headlines earlier this offseason when he took a shot at another Yankee that wore one digit: Babe Ruth. The recently-signed reliever said on a podcast that he could easily strike out the baseball legend.

"I'm not trying to disrespect him, you know, rest in peace, you know, shoutout to Babe Ruth," Ottavino said. "But it was a different game. I mean, the guy ate hot dogs and drank beer and did whatever he did. It was just a different game."

Yankees fans can hope that Ottavino's Yankees tenure ends as well as the players who wore Nos. 1-9.

Yankees retired numbers

1: Billy Martin

2: Derek Jeter

3: Babe Ruth

4: Lou Gehrig

5: Joe DiMaggio

6: Joe Torre

7: Mickey Mantle

8: Bill Dickey and Yogi Berra

9: Roger Maris

10: Phil Rizzuto

15: Thurman Munson

16: Whitey Ford

20: Jorge Posada

23: Don Mattingly

32: Elston Howard

37: Casey Stengel

42: Mariano Rivera

44: Reggie Jackson

46: Andy Pettitte

49: Ron Guidry

51: Bernie Williams
